page.title: 09The Gurdwara
page.content: The Guru Nanak Sikh Temple or Gurdwara was opened in November 1978 making use of a building formally occupied by Armstrong Stevens Ltd. as works offices. The original building was extended and in November 1981 the new building was opened. Prior to the provision of this amenity, worshippers were forced to travel to Gurdwaras in Walsall or Wolverhampton. The main function of the Gurdwara is to promote the Sikh faith, but ceremonies such as weddings, funerals and choosing of children's names are performed there also. About 500 people attend Gurdwara each week. Most come from the local area but anyone is welcome. Work is at present underway to improve the catering facilities at the Gurdwara.
